fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In Jira Service Desk version 4.7.1, the date fields split into two lines in the queue. The issue is specific to the Linux environment, works fine in a Windows environment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Create some issues with the due date and check the queue.

h3. Expected Results
The due and create date fields should not split to the next line

h3. Actual Results
The date fields split into two lines
 !screenshot_219.png|thumbnail! 

Jira 8.5.0 doesn't show the same issue. The issue is replicable on both Chrome and Firefox browsers.
 !screenshot_219.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
The behavior is caused due to fixed column width 70 px for date fields which is not enough for Linux environment. Modify the project-queue-react-table.11ec2bcb91b8f432dc30.css in the servicedesk-frontend-plugin-4.7.1-REL-0008.jar and changed the width from 70px to 75px.
fields.summary: Date fields get split into two lines in the Service Desk queue in Linux Environment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary Accessibility issue: 'Tab' key navigation going off issue create screen in Customer portal h3. Steps to Reproduce # Login as a service desk customer to Customer Portal # Open 'create issue' screen # Start pressing 'tab' key on the keyboard. Notice that the 'tab' focus cycles through the options on the page and browser controls # Add a few comments by using keyboard only and keep cycling through the page options via 'tab' key h3. Expected Results Tab focus should consistently cycle through the issue screen options and browser control elements by pressing the 'tab' key the same number of times. h3. Actual Results Tab focus disappears after "Jira Service Desk" logo goes in focus, and then seemingly disappears. I.e. user hits 'tab' - nothing happens, 'tab' again - nothing. And then after clicking 'tab' multiple times, the focus comes back. The following HTML elements are added to the page HTML every time an action such as saving a comment is added: {code}
{code} This is the element where 'tab focus' goes to. Since the element is multipled every time a comment is made or action is done, next time user cycles through the option, it needs extra 'tab' to get the focus back. While the elements can't be seen on the screen, it's there in the HTML and is where the 'tab' focus goes. h3. Workaround Keep pressing 'tab' key for as many times as required to get the focus back
fields.summary: Accessibility issue: 'Tab' key navigation going off issue create screen in Customer portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
As an Agent, when editing a Customer's comment, agent can click on 'Share with customer' to save the changes and make the comment Public, as it originally is. However, the saved comment will be saved as Internal, hence not visible in the Customer Portal.

This has been observed in JSD 4.7.0 & 4.7.1.
*Bug started in 4.5.4 (8.5.4)*

*Note:* This doesn't affect Agents' Public comments

h3. Steps to Reproduce
(i) Use a Service Desk project with default Permission Scheme, specifically the *Browse project* permission
# As a Customer, leave a comment in a Request via Customer Portal
# As an Agent, access the Request via Jira
# Edit the Customer's comment and click 'Share with customer'
# The saved comment will be Internal, not Public

h3. Expected Results
Clicking 'Share with customer' will save the comment and share to Public

h3. Actual Results
Saved comment is Internal

h3. Workaround
Granting the Customers the *Browse projects* permission, (on top of the default 'Service desk customer - portal access'). This can be granted via single user, roles or groups. Once granted, Customers' comments can be edited and shared publicly by Agents as usual. 
{panel:borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#000000|bgColor=#FFF4D1}
(!) Doing so will grant the Customers permissions to access the Project via Jira and see all the Issues should they have Application Access. If they don't, this Workaround should work similarly like Service Desk as expected.
{panel}

If the Workaround is applied and the Customers have Application Access, it is possible to restrict the Tickets to only the Reporters and Assignee via Issue Security Scheme. Below are the suggested actions to take:
{panel}
# Go to *Administration > Issues > Issue Security Scheme*. Click 'Add issue security scheme'.
# In the newly added Issue Security Scheme, click 'Security Levels'. Add a Security Level (e.g.: Level 1).
# In the newly added Security Level, click 'Default'
** This is to set this Security Level as the default when Requests are created in Projects using this Issue Security Scheme
# Then click 'Add'. Add 'Reporter' and 'Project Role: Service Desk Team' into the Security Level.
** This would mean only the Reporter and members of Service Desk Team Project Role would be able to access Requests restricted with this Security Level
# Go to the Service Desk Project, *Project Settings > Issue Security*. Click 'Actions > Select a scheme', then choose the created Issue Security Level.

Now newly created Requests would only be accessible by the Reporter and Service Desk Team Project Role (Agents) despite being shared to the Organization.
{panel}
fields.summary: Edited Customers' comment cannot be saved as Public

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

dates column and summary in the projects queue have line breaks when the date in look and feel is set with backslash spacing sign
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # in Jira Administration Look and Feel set the *Day.Month.Year format* with the / sign as a spacing sign. (*ex. yyyy/MM/dd*)
 # in a project already populated with some issues switch to the *Queue* tab
 # observe that the Summary and all columns which contains dates fields have line breaks, differently from the previous versions and the expected behaviour
 !Screenshot 2020-01-27 at 17.06.39.png|width=404,height=216!

h3. Expected Results

There should be no break line in the Summary and in the dates fields as in the previous versions.
h3. Actual Results

There are break lines in the Summary column and in all the dates fields and the aspect of the queue is now pretty awful.
h3. Workaround

As tested by the customer and reproduced by me, if in Administration > Look and Feel the *Day.Month.Year format* is set using a *.* instead of a */* as a spacing sign (*ex. yyyy.MM.dd*) then the queue looks like in the previous versions and there are no line breaks anymore.
fields.summary: dates column and summary in the projects queue have line breaks when the date in look and feel is set with backslash spacing sign

Currently, the JSD customer portal only searches a word or partial words with has a wildcard in it, for example, t*st will return summary that has *"test"*, in order to search in the customer portal. However, if the summary has certain characters like underscore, comma, colon, semi-colon, <, >, +, -, etc, it will not return anything.

Create an issue with the following characters
h3. Expected Results

When the user is searching the issue summary include the characters, the issues must show

The issue does not show as expected:
 * digi*

!image-2020-02-21-15-00-22-163.png|width=410,height=234!
 * __digi*

!image-2020-02-21-14-59-46-201.png|width=440,height=114!
 * [www.abc.com*|http://www.abc.com%2A/]

!image-2020-02-21-14-59-23-713.png|width=472,height=116!

!image-2020-02-21-15-01-15-011.png|width=405,height=198!

!image-2020-02-21-15-01-56-989.png|width=432,height=138!

It seems that the searching mechanism is not in order, where the symbols/characters are used in the summary.

There is no workaround at the moment.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

I was dismayed to read in JSDSERVER-4382 that in 4.7 all new requests will be private.

Our JSD portal, which services over 200 external client companies whose issues must be hidden from each other, is specifically crafted to to require that the Organization MUST be specified and this works well in pre-4.7.

This change is going to confuse our external users who will get an error that not all fields are filled in and they must choose organization. But that field is not labeled Organization (at least it's not in our current version). I know this because for our few end users that work for more than one organization, which sets requests to Private by default, explaining to them what the error message means and how to set the organization field, has been quite daunting.

Please make the default to have the Org set or Private configurable by project.

 
h3. Workaround

(!) Please note that it is possible to disable the new behavior introduced in the *Customer Portal* in JSD 4.7.x by following the steps below:
 - Navigate to the following page to access the Dark Features page:
{code:java}
<baseUrl>/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!Default.jspa
{code}

 - Enter *sd.customer.share.default.private.disabled* in the field *Enable dark feature*, click on the *Add* button, and verify that the dark feature *sd.customer.share.default.private.disabled* is listed in the page:
 !DarkFeature.png|thumbnail!

After you followed these steps, if a customer is a member of exactly 1 organization, this organization will be automatically selected in the request creation form (as it used to be the case before JSD 4.7.x

 
h2. 4.9.0 Release

Customers can get the pre 4.7 default sharing behaviour back. More details - 
[https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-4-9-x-release-notes-1005326200.html#JiraServiceDesk4.9.xreleasenotes-sharingiscaring]
fields.summary: Backtrack 4.7 change that makes all new requests private to be configurable per project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is not clear that when a user selects "Turn off email requests" that their settings will be removed completely; the wording can be read to indicate that requests will simply be _off_, rather than removed. Since not all Jira users have immediate access to the necessary email information (e.g., in some organizations, only specific administrators have access to email passwords), this can cause unnecessary downtime. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a Service Desk project, go to Settings -> Email requests
 # Add an email address
 # Select "Turn off email requests"
 # Add an email address
 # Observe that the original settings are gone.

h3. Suggestion

Users should always know when they are about to permanently remove or alter system settings. There are at least a couple ways we can do this:
 * We could communicate this with more precise wording (e.g., "Delete email requests") 
 * We could provide additional information (e.g., in a pop-up) that alerts them to the fact that their settings will be unalterably removed
 * Additionally, this should be documented, so users can verify the behaviour before committing to deleting their settings.
fields.summary: Give warning that "Turn off email requests" removes settings or change wording of button

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Per the feature request https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-1942, the Service Desk mail handler is capable to convert HTML content from an incoming email into Wiki Text, so that the HTML formatting can be rendered in the description of the ticket created by email.

Unfortunately, when the HTML encoding gets very complex (for example when using Outlook) and contains a lot of '<span>' elements as well as bold and italic marks, it may happen that the conversion into Wiki Text gets rendered incorrectly. Especially, some hyperlinks might be converted into a table.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Create a Service Desk project
- Configure a Mail Handler in this project via *Project Settings > Email Requests*
- Send an email that contains a lot of complex HTML formatting to the mail handler
-- Example of HTML formatting:
 [^htmlcontent_ForFeatureRequest.html] 
-- Example of email source file containing the complex HTML formatting:
 [^mail_ForFeatureRequest.eml] 
- Wait for the email to be processed


h3. Expected Results
The full HTML content is properly converted into Wiki Text in the ticket description, and reflects the rendering of the email:
 !EmailRendering_ForFeatureRequest.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Some of the links from the HTML content is cut off and also end up creating some weird table in the ticket description:
 !WikiTextRendering_ForFeatureRequest.png|thumbnail!

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
In Jira Service Desk, a Project Administrator can create an automation rule that can bypass the restriction whereby JIRA administrators only can create webhooks in JIRA.

There are situations where customers would want only jira administrators to be able to create webhooks and restrict project admins from doing so

This feature request is to make the functionality customisable. 
For example allow JIRA administrators only to decide which users (including JSD project admins) can have the ability to create webhooks.
fields.summary: Restrict Project Admins from creating webhooks via JSD automation rules

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, there's no easy way in JIRA service desk to identify which automation rules have webhooks configured in them.

This request is to provide JIRA administrators with an ability to easily identify which automation rules have webhooks configured as action without having to click on each and every rule in the many configured rules.

h5. Workaround:

The following SQL query should give an idea as to what rules in JSD automation have webhooks configured:

{code}
select a."CONFIG_DATA_VALUE", a."THEN_ACTION_CONFIG_ID", b."IF_THEN_ID", b."ID" as b_ID, c."RULE_ID", e."NAME" from "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACT_CONF_DATA" a 
join "AO_9B2E3B_THEN_ACTION_CONFIG" b on b."ID"=a."THEN_ACTION_CONFIG_ID"
join "AO_9B2E3B_IF_THEN" c on b."IF_THEN_ID" = c."ID"
join "AO_9B2E3B_RULE" d on c."RULE_ID" = d."ID"
join "AO_9B2E3B_RULESET_REVISION" e on d."ID" = e."ID"
where a."CONFIG_DATA_VALUE" like '%http%';
{code}
fields.summary: Additional monitoring & Logging for Jira Service Desk automation webhooks

fields.description:
*Problem:*
 Currently when the customers create a request and share with an organization, the other customers in the organization can see the request.

But when they try to share the request to themselves - they will get an error saying: *Sorry, but the following users do not belong to your organizations: xyz*. However they are able to share it with other customers from same organization. The error message also has an impact in this scenario.
 - with customer permission se to - "Other customers in their organization",  we are not able to share the request with self.
 - If we change to share with any customer by typing email address, we are able share the request with self.

*Steps to reproduce:*
 - Create an organization and add a few Users (Usera, Userb, Userc)
 - Create a new request as usera and share this with the organization.
 - Userb can now login into the service desk and see the request, however if they try to share the request with self, gets error message.
 - If the users becomes an agent (granting the role Service Desk Team) he can share the request with himself.

*Expectation:*
 - Customers who are part of an organization should be able to share the request with themselves - with customer permission for sharing set to : Other customers in their organization.
fields.summary: Request shared with an organization should allow customers to share request the with themselves

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The "Full name" search on "Change Default event User" user dropdown did not return the expected user. 

Scenario:
* "Full name" is "Autobot"
* "Email address" of users part of SD project administrator or Agent team has "@autobot.test"
* Searching for "Autobot" will return all users with "@autobot.test" email that met the permission condition. They will all be listed under {{/rest/servicedesk/1/servicedesk/sd-user-search/<project>/usersWithBrowseAndEditPermissions}} request *but will not be shown* under the UI dropdown.

h3. Environment
* Service desk installed
* Automation enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup JSD project, configure Automation
# Have more than 10 users with "@autobot.test" email address
# Have 1 user with full name "Autobot" 
# Ensure the users have Administrator or Agent/Team permission to JSD project
# Try to change the user in *Automation > Change Default event User* 

h3. Expected Results
The search only search for user's Full Name and return the user in the dropdown

h3. Actual Results
The search goes through the "Full name" and "Email address" *but* did not list the user that matches the "Email address" in the dropdown
 

h3. Workaround
Ensure the user that is to be set in "Change Default event User" to have a unique "Full name" to the list of "Full name" and "Email address"
fields.summary: Change Default event User did not return correct list of Users in Dropdown

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new queue design introduces an additional scrollbar at small browser height (~570px).

Scrolling through the results causes the inner container to pause, then forces the user to scroll down again to make the outer container scroll.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # View a queue that contains enough issues to scroll through.
 # Reduce the browser height until an additional scrollbar is created outside the results window.

h3. Expected Results

A seamless scrolling experience at any browser size - comparable to the Issue Navigator or previous queue experience.
h3. Actual Results

When a user scrolls through the list of work items, they reach the end, but can't see the pagination controls until they move their mouse to the outer scrollbar and scroll again.

This can cause a confusing experience for the users with lower resolutions or have hi-dpi scaling on.

!image-2020-01-27-14-33-11-020.png|width=774,height=266!
h3. Workaround

End users may be able to mitigate this behaviour by making changes at their OS level. See the following Bug Workaround step for instructions on how to enact this:

* [Double scroll bars in Watchers list - JRASERVER-70658|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-70658]
fields.summary: New queue design introduces additional scrollbar at small browser size

The queue is not correctly ordered based on the time remaining for that SLA, but instead, it has inconsistent ordering, not actually based on the time remaining

No workaround is known. Reconstruct the SLAs does not work.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On busy large Jira instance (Jira 8.3.0+ with JSD 4.3.0 or higher), the {{SdOffThreadEventJobRunner}} threads might run into an active deadlock situation constantly trying to poll the PSMQ table.

Summary of the problem:
* As of JSD 4.3.0 the {{SdOffThreadEventJobRunner}} thread pool is limited to _5 threads_ by default.
* Upon an issue update, If none of the 5 threads have issue context to process the first item in the queue, none of them will be able to process that event and they will continue polling the queue forever.
* This problem could be triggered on a large very active instance, mainly if a certain issue is getting too frequent updates in a short time.
* This could result is a huge database pressure and could cause a performance issue for Jira is the database can't keep up. 
* Such a deadlock will be resolved eventually, but some issues might end up with a corrupted SLA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* NA - was not able to reproduce locally.
* The issue was observed on large very active client instances

h3. Expected Results
* The {{SdOffThreadEventJobRunner}} thread should not be polling messages over and over in a deadlock situation.
* The amount of traffic to the database should be normal.

h3. Actual Results
The logs _(with Debug enabled on *com.querydsl*)_ show a huge amount of queries (*40k+*) hitting the database over and over:
{noformat}
$ grep "AO_319474_QUEUE" atlassian-jira.log.*|grep "update" |grep 'set "CLAIMANT" =' |cut -d" " -f6,9 |sort |uniq -c
      5  
   9110 1005x1479882x8 /servicedesk/customer/portal/9/create/94
  18379 1005x1480033x3 /rest/api/2/issue/SAT-30983/comment
  12949 1005x1480061x6 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa

$ grep -n "AO_319474_MESSAGE" atlassian-jira.log* |grep "count(" |cut -d" " -f6,9 |sort |uniq -c
      3  
   9407 1005x1479882x8 /servicedesk/customer/portal/9/create/94
  18631 1005x1480033x3 /rest/api/2/issue/SAT-30983/comment
  13325 1005x1480061x6 /secure/CommentAssignIssue.jspa
  {noformat}
Also checking the *AO_319474_MESSAGE* table shows that there is at least 1 message that is being claimed more than once:
 !screenshot_159.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Note
* Increasing the number of SdOffThreadEventJobRunner threads from 5 to 12 didn't actually help mitigate the issue.
* Increasing the threads much further to a much bigger number could trigger another issue similar to what was fixed by _OffThreadEventJobRunner uses an unbounded ThreadPoolExecutor that can exhaust the DBCP_ - JSDSERVER-5732
* Related KB - [Deadlocking in Jira Service Desk when frequently updating the same issue|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/deadlocking-in-jira-service-desk-when-frequently-updating-the-same-issue-979428323.html]

h3. Workaround
There is no known effective workaround for this issue currently.
fields.summary: Working on busy Jira instance could result in a deadlock condition for the SdOffThreadEventJobRunner while scanning PSMQ queues.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Customer login session expires, Comments they have entered but not submitted is lost.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JSD as a customer.
# Go to an existing ticket.
# Enter text in a new comment but do not submit it.
# Go do something else for a while until your session times out.
# Try to submit the new comment.

h3. Expected Results
* JSD should tell me my session is expired and suggest that I save my work, then give me a chance to copy my text elsewhere.

h3. Actual Results
* A red error message *briefly* appears on screen then the page is reloaded.
* My comment in progress is lost.

h3. Workaround
None. Customers are likely to learn to mistrust the UI, expending extra effort to copy/save their work before submitting. Or they will compose replies elsewhere such as email or a text file.
fields.summary: Show a helpful error message and allow customer to copy their un-submitted comment when session expires

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Adding a comment on an issue or creating an issue in a none Java Service Desk project while Service Desk is installed on Jira, results in JSD PSMQ off thread event handling code kicking in and processing the event. 
The PSMQ code is executed without an obvious need in case the project is a Jira Software or a Jira Core.
This could result is increased database pressure due to the amount of queries hitting the PSMQ tables and could also increase the pressure on the {{SdOffThreadEventJobRunner}} thread pool.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Jira Software install Jira Service Desk
 # Create a Jira Software KANBAN project and create an issue inside it.
 # Enable debug logging on the package *com.querydsl*
 # Add a comment to the above issue.

h3. Expected Results
Since we are adding a comment to a KANBAN issue, no Jira Service Desk code should be executed.

h3. Actual Results
Jira Service DESK PMSQ code is executed and queries are being sent to the {{JSD AO_319474_QUEUE}} and {{AO_319474_MESSAGE}} tables.

h3. Note
The below logs are seen in _the atlassian-jira.log_, in this case case {{SdOffThreadEventJobRunner}} threads generated 80 different queries for a single comment (Select/Update):
{noformat}
sabdelfattah@ulmo ~/deployments/jira850/jira-home/log $ grep "/rest/api/2/issue/KAN-14/comment" atlassian-jira.log |grep SdOffThreadEventJobRunner |wc -l
80

sabdelfattah@ulmo ~/deployments/jira850/jira-home/log $ grep "/rest/api/2/issue/KAN-14/comment" atlassian-jira.log |grep SdOffThreadEventJobRunner |head
2020-01-21 15:04:37,940 SdOffThreadEventJobRunner:thread-3 DEBUG sherif 904x184x1 xhb8zs 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/issue/KAN-14/comment [c.querydsl.sql.AbstractSQLQuery] select "AO_319474_QUEUE"."CLAIMANT", "AO_319474_QUEUE"."CLAIMANT_TIME", "AO_319474_QUEUE"."CREATED_TIME", "AO_319474_QUEUE"."ID", "AO_319474_QUEUE"."MESSAGE_COUNT", "AO_319474_QUEUE"."MODIFIED_TIME", "AO_319474_QUEUE"."NAME", "AO_319474_QUEUE"."PURPOSE", "AO_319474_QUEUE"."TOPIC" from "public"."AO_319474_QUEUE" "AO_319474_QUEUE" where "AO_319474_QUEUE"."NAME" = ? limit ?
2020-01-21 15:04:37,942 SdOffThreadEventJobRunner:thread-3 DEBUG sherif 904x184x1 xhb8zs 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/issue/KAN-14/comment [c.querydsl.sql.AbstractSQLQuery] select count(*) from "public"."AO_319474_MESSAGE" "AO_319474_MESSAGE" where "AO_319474_MESSAGE"."QUEUE_ID" = ? and ("AO_319474_MESSAGE"."CLAIMANT" is null or "AO_319474_MESSAGE"."CLAIMANT" is not null and ("AO_319474_MESSAGE"."CLAIMANT_TIME" is null or "AO_319474_MESSAGE"."CLAIMANT_TIME" < ?))
2020-01-21 15:04:37,942 SdOffThreadEventJobRunner:thread-3 DEBUG sherif 904x184x1 xhb8zs 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/issue/KAN-14/comment [c.querydsl.sql.AbstractSQLQuery] select "AO_319474_QUEUE_PROPERTY"."ID", "AO_319474_QUEUE_PROPERTY"."LONG_VALUE", "AO_319474_QUEUE_PROPERTY"."NAME", "AO_319474_QUEUE_PROPERTY"."PROPERTY_TYPE", "AO_319474_QUEUE_PROPERTY"."QUEUE_ID", "AO_319474_QUEUE_PROPERTY"."STRING_VALUE" from "public"."AO_319474_QUEUE_PROPERTY" "AO_319474_QUEUE_PROPERTY" where "AO_319474_QUEUE_PROPERTY"."QUEUE_ID" = ?
2020-01-21 15:04:37,943 SdOffThreadEventJobRunner:thread-3 DEBUG sherif 904x184x1 xhb8zs 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/issue/KAN-14/comment [c.q.sql.dml.SQLInsertClause] update "public"."AO_319474_QUEUE" set "CLAIMANT" = ?, "CLAIMANT_TIME" = ? where "AO_319474_QUEUE"."ID" = ? and ("AO_319474_QUEUE"."CLAIMANT" is null or "AO_319474_QUEUE"."CLAIMANT" is not null and "AO_319474_QUEUE"."CLAIMANT_TIME" < ?)
2020-01-21 15:04:37,945 SdOffThreadEventJobRunner:thread-3 DEBUG sherif 904x184x1 xhb8zs 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/api/2/issue/KAN-14/comment [c.q.sql.dml.SQLInsertClause] update "public"."AO_319474_MESSAGE" set "CLAIMANT" = ?, "CLAIMANT_TIME" = ? where "AO_319474_MESSAGE"."QUEUE_ID" = ? and "AO_319474_MESSAGE"."CLAIMANT" is not null

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 March 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

The option to configure Confluence knowledge base space creation was shipped in [JSM 4.14|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-management-4-14-x-release-notes-1027133928.html].

To manage this setting as a Jira administrator:
 # Choose *Administration > Applications*. Scroll down to the *Jira Service Management* section and choose *Configuration*.
 # In the *Knowledge base* section, you can change whether a Confluence knowledge base space is automatically created when creating a service project.

Kind regards,

Charlie

Jira Service Management, Server & Data Center
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

Currently , when creating a new JIRA Service Desk project , it will automatically create a Confluence space when the instance have Confluence application installed/linked.
h3. Suggested Solution

Options to create or not to create the space.
h3. Why this is important

Sometimes the JIRA Service Desk not required to have a knowledge base , so creating a space is not required.
h3. Workaround

Application Link (Authentication Methods) does the trick, using OAuth is unable to replicate the behavior. You can refer to [*this documentation*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/applinks/oauth-security-for-application-links-774045732.html] on the differences between OAuth and OAuth Impersonation. Using the bug as a workaround will causing you unable to create new space in Confluence from JIRA. If the project admin is able to access to Confluence to create new space and update Service Desk Project KB configuration to space manually, then OAuth shall be workable in this scenario.
fields.summary: Options to disable auto creating Confluence space with creating JIRA Service Desk project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Atlassian plugin vendor are extending SimpleUrlReadingCondition according to https://bitbucket.org/atlassian_tutorial/tutorial-licensed-conditions/src/master/src/main/java/com/example/plugins/conditions/IsPluginLicensedCondition.java. When using this condition to load a web-resource in the customerportal context, the wrong resource is loaded. 

As a consequence:
- a lot of Service Desk portal URLs are corrupted since the string "customer/portal/undefined/servicedesk" is being mistakenly added to it, and accessing such URL returns a 404 error with the message "Oops, you've found a dead link".
- some functionalities from the customer portal will fail to work: for example, icon/avatar images might not be loaded on the customer, workflow transitions might fail on the customer portal, etc...


For example:
- Customer Portal Icons (Avatar):
-- A normal icon URL should be like this:
{code}
<JIRA_BASE_URL>/servicedesk/customershim/secure/viewavatar?avatarType=SD_REQTYPE&avatarId=10610
{code}
-- However, when the bug occurs, the URL is modified to the following invalid URL:
{code}
<JIRA_BASE_URL>/servicedesk/customer/undefined/servicedesk/customershim/secure/viewavatar?avatarType=SD_REQTYPE&avatarId=10610
{code}
- Customer Portal Transition
-- A normal transition URL should be like this:
{code}
<JIRA_BASE_URL>/rest/servicedesk/1/customer/requests/transition
{code}
-- However, when the bug occurs, the URL is modified to the following invalid URL:
{code}
<JIRA_BASE_URL>/servicedesk/customer/portal/37/undefined/rest/servicedesk/1/customer/requests/transition
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a test plugin that uses a condition to load resources on the customer portal (see screenshots/attachments)

h4. atlassian-plugin.xml snippet


{code:xml}
    <web-resource key="test-true" name="test-true">
        <resource type="download" name="condition-true.js" location="/js/condition-true.js"/>
        <context>customerportal</context>
        <condition class="com.atlassian.test.impl.TestCondition"/>
    </web-resource>

    <web-resource key="test-false" name="test-false">
        <resource type="download" name="condition-false.js" location="/js/condition-false.js"/>
        <context>customerportal</context>
        <condition class="com.atlassian.test.impl.TestCondition" invert="true"/>
    </web-resource>
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The resource associated with the TestCondition being true is loaded

h3. Actual Results

The resource associated with the TestCondition being false is loaded

h3. Workaround

Enable the feature flag {{sd.frontend.legacy.webresource.loading.customerportal.enabled}}:
# Go to [Dark feature page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/enable-dark-feature-in-jira-959286331.html] (<baseURL>/secure/admin/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa)
# Add the following dark feature flag: {{sd.frontend.legacy.webresource.loading.customerportal.enabled}}
fields.summary: Incorrect resources are loaded based on condition in Customer Portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding attachment via the Agent View and when no comment is entered, even though the Agent presses 'Share with customer' button, the attachment does not become visible to customer

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login to JIRA Service Desk 4.5.2 via portal as a customer, create a new case
# From another browser, login to the same JSD as Agent, locate the case logged by the customer in the step above and upload an attachment either via drag and drop, or via the 'browse' option (i) Don't add any comments, just click "Share with customer" button

h3. Expected Results

The attachment should become visible to customer via the portal

h3. Actual Results

The attachment is not visible

h3. Workaround

Option 1a: For new attachments, add any comment before pressing "Share with customer" button.
Option 1b: For new attachments, add them by opening the ticket from the customer facing view
Option 2: For existing attachments, reference the attachment in a new public comment via the wiki markup [^filename]


h3. Additional notes:

This happens only in JIRA Service Desk 4.5.2 onwards, JSD 4.5.1 doesn't seem to be affected
fields.summary: Sharing attachment with no comment does not make the attachment visible to customer via the portal

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, the customer lookup handling in Service Desk has the following constraints by design:
 * Customers can be only searchable in the Customer portal if they are members of the Customers list.
 * There are additional conditions that need to be fulfilled, based on the "Customer permissions" settings:
 ** A reporter will only be able to search for users who are members of the same organization, if "Other customers in their organization" is set.
 ** If you want to grant permission to a reporter to browse through all users who are on the customer list, you need to select "Any customer or organization, by searching in this project". (see attached screenshot)

The purpose of this feature request is to allow the customers to see other users from the portal (in User Picker fields for example) that are not necessarily customers and without modifying the permissions in the project's "Customer permissions".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Created a custom field "User Picker" filtered for jira-servicedesk-users group and added it to my IT help Request Type portal.
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-14 at 5.25.58 PM.png|width=137,height=100!

 * Created some users, only user2 is added to service desk customers group
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-14 at 5.28.51 PM.png|width=144,height=72!

 * Set the customer permission in my project to "Customers who are added to the project"
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-14 at 5.30.34 PM.png|width=132,height=65!

 * Added user1 manually to the list of customers in my project to have at least two customers:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-14 at 5.31.56 PM.png|width=215,height=78!

 * Log in as user1, try to create a request and add users to the User Picker field.

h3. Expected Results

user1 should be able to search for the other users from the portal regardless of the project's "customer permissions" i.g there should be an option to set who is visible from the portal.
h3. Actual Results
 * Tried to create a request as user1, in the user picker field, it only suggests user2 from the list of users (I am also able to search the admin, but not the other users)
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-14 at 5.32.34 PM.png|width=207,height=141!
 * Changed the permission in my project to allow Customers who have an account on this Jira site to open requests. Now I have the other users as customers in my project. I tried to create a request as user1, in the user picker field, now it shows the other users:
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-14 at 5.35.00 PM.png|width=193,height=162! 
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-14 at 5.36.05 PM.png|width=192,height=98! 
 !Screen Shot 2020-01-14 at 5.37.09 PM.png|width=186,height=128!

h3. Workaround

For now, the workaround is to loosen the permission to enable "Customers who have an account on this Jira site" to raise requests so that they are considered as customers and will show in the User Picker field in the portal, and use third-party plugins to restrict the creation of the requests for a restricted group.



h3. Note

This issue might be related to JSDSERVER-5406 since it addresses user lookup vs customer permissions in JSD.
fields.summary: Improve the customer lookup function

Upon upgrade to JSD 4.6, JIRA Service desk does not make rest calls to third-party add-on (Insight) causing custom fields to fail in Portal.

 # -

h3. Expected Results

Add-on provided the custom field is not editable on the Customer portal.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the Reporter is a Customer, the SLA condition "Comment:For Customers" would not trigger when a Public Comment is made.
(i) This Bug does not affect 4.6.0
(!) This Bug is occurring despite the Permission Scheme is set to grant 'Browse Project' permission to 'Service desk customer - portal access'.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Service Desk Project
# Configure SLA as follows:
** Start: Issue Created
** Stop: Comment: For Customers
# Create a new Issue
# Ensure the Reporter is a Customer user
# Login as an agent user and add a Public Comment to the ticket

h3. Expected Results
The SLA would stop as the SLA Condition 'Comment: For Customers' is met when Public Comment is added

h3. Actual Results
The SLA does not stop even when the SLA Condition 'Comment: For Customers' is met when Public Comment is added

h3. Workaround
Create a Group/Project Role (e.g.: Service Desk Customers), add all the Customer users into the Group/Project Role and grant the 'Browse Project' permission to the Group/Project Role.
fields.summary: The SLA condition "Comment:For Customers" does not trigger if Reporter is a Customer that does not have direct 'Browse Project' permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating and saving a new holiday to a calendar with existing holidays, the dates of the previous holidays decrease by one day (they go one day into the past). e.g. New Year's Day (January 1) changes to December 31 after adding an additional holiday.

The problem can also be triggered by modifying the Working Hours for the calendar and clicking Save. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or modify a calendar for an SLA
 # Add a holiday
 # Save the calendar
 # Edit the calendar and add another holiday
 # Save the calendar again
 # Edit the calendar again to observe the dates on the holidays - the holiday created in step 2 will have decremented its date by one day

h3. Expected Results

Previously saved holidays remain on the correct date.
h3. Actual Results

Previously saved / existing holidays have their date set backward by one day. This continues for each additional time the calendar is saved. For example, a holiday on January 5 will move backwards to January 1 if four more holidays are added to the calendar (and saved individually).

!image-2020-01-14-14-54-49-157.png|width=507,height=224!
h3. Workaround

Disable the new Calendar view (introduced in Service Desk 4.4) via Dark Feature:
 * Go to the darkfeature page: <Jira_URL>/secure/SiteDarkFeatures!default.jspa
 * Add the following feature:
{code:java}
sd.workinghours.new.page.disabled{code}
fields.summary: Existing holidays decrement by one day when adding a new holiday to an SLA calendar

Post-functions:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Approve and Decline buttons of the Service Desk approval workflow are broken in the Jira Issue View. Instead they work on the Customer Portal.

Also, the Welcome guide and the "Account verification email" setting in the Project settings are not showing as well.

I observed that this is only happening when the Jira Service Desk application is installed on top of Jira Software and not vice versa.

The buttons are correctly working if Jira Service Desk 4.6.0 is installed alone and also if the Jira Software application is then installed on top of that.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install Jira Software 8.6.0.
 # Install Jira Service Desk 4.6.0 on top of Jira Software 8.6.0.
 # Create a new Service Desk process with the Approval Request Issue or configure the Approval flow manually in the workflow.
 # Create an issue and add an approver in it.
 # step at the status which require to Approve or Decline the issue
 # login with the approver account and in the issue created above *Issue View* clic on the *Approve or Decline* buttons.
 # observe that nothing happens, the buttons are broken, the redirection is made on the issue itself and a # is added at the very end of the issue URL.
 !Screenshot_2020-01-10_at_12_15_08.jpg|thumbnail!
 # go on the correspondent customer portal page and check that the Approve and Decline buttons are actually working well there.

h3. Expected Results

the buttons should transition the issue to the Approved or Declined/Rejected status
h3. Actual Results

the buttons are broken/unresponsive
 No exceptions are thrown out in the logs.
h3. Workaround

The issue seems to be related to the missing Atlassian Chaperone component into the JSD 4.6.0 installer so the workaround for now is to manually upload the [^atlassian-chaperone-4.6.1-REL-0001.jar] file from *Administration>Manage Apps>Upload App*.
 After doing the above the buttons are operational again.
fields.summary: The Approve and Decline buttons of the Service Desk approval workflow are broken in the Jira Issue View

fields.description:
Summary
If you translate Service Desk statuses but the agent and the customer use different languages, the status name that is used on the customer notification, is the Agent one.

Steps to Reproduce
# Have a customer and an agent with different languages
# Translate your workflow statuses
# Create Notification as:
English: "${event.user.name} changed the status to '${request.status}'."
Dutch: "${event.user.name} heeft de status gewijzigd in '${request.status}'."
# Transition the ticket to one of these statuses and verify the customer notification
Examples:
Agent=ENG/Customer=NL --> "Agent1 heeft de status gewijzigd in 'In Progress'."
Agent=NL/Customer=ENG --> "Agent1  changed the status to 'Wordt aan gewerkt'."
# The status name in the notification will be translated to Agent's language and not customer language.

Expected Results
Status names used in customer notification is customer language.

Actual Results
Status name used in customer notification is agent language.

Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Translated status doesn't work in customer notifications

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Agents are forbidden from adding an existing customer to an Organization with the error in the screenshot below.
 !permission.png|thumbnail!
h3. Steps to reproduce the problem
 # Ensure that the configuration to allow agents to manage organization via *Administration > Applications > JIRA Service Desk configuration* is set to _Yes, agents can add and remove organizations from projects, and add and remove customers from organizations_
 # Disable the outgoing mail server.
 # Log in as an Agent and add an existing customer to an Organization.

h3. Expected result

The Agent is not able to add the customer to the Organization with relevant error about Outgoing mail configuration
h3. Actual result

The Agent is not able to add the customer to the Organization and the misleading error about permission is thrown
h3. Notes

An Agent will not be able to invite a customer to an Organization if any of the conditions below is true
 * The configuration to allow agents to manage organization via *Administration > Applications > JIRA Service Desk configuration* is set to {{No, only JIRA administrators can manage organizations}}
 * The Outgoing Mail Server is not configured
 * The Outgoing Mail is disabled

h3. Workaround
 * Ensure that the Outgoing Mail Server is configured and enabled
 * Admins can add customer to an Organization without a working Outgoing Mail Server
fields.summary: Agents do not have the permission to add a customer to an Organization

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When Jira is connected to 2 Confluence server instances via an application link, viewing a knowledge base article (KB article) from the request creation page might lead to either either below:
- Error 1:
{code}
The knowledge base article could not be found.
{code}
 !Error1.png|thumbnail! 
- Error 2:
{code}
We can't link to Confluence because of a problem with the metadata. You can try refreshing the page, but it probably won't fix this one
{code}
 !Error2.png|thumbnail! 

Note that opening the same KB article from the Customer Portal page (instead of the request creation page) will work properly:
 !PageWorks.png|thumbnail! 

This issue comes from the fact that:
- when the KB article is accessed from the portal, the KB URL contains the application ID matching the right Confluence instance, for example:
{code}
http://localhost:8084/jira842/servicedesk/customer/kb/view/65606?applicationId=79df3f51-590a-36d2-9c2b-85f72a6b90d1&portalId=2&pageNumber=1&q=laptop&q_time=1578500997521
{code}
- when the KB article is accessed from the request creation page, the KB URL does not contain the application ID, therefore Jira selects by default the Confluence instance set as "Primary" in the application links page, rather than the one the Confluence instance the KB belongs to.
{code}
http://localhost:8084/jira842/servicedesk/customer/kb/view/65606
{code}

h3. Steps to reproduce

- Setup 2 Confluence instances
-- The first one will be referred to as "Confluence"
-- The second one will be referred to as "Confluence 2"
- Create a new space in "Confluence 2", and create a page containing the word "laptop"
- Setup 1 Jira instance
- Configure 2 application links in Jira, 1 to each Confluence instance, with the application link to "Confluence" set to the primary one:
 !AppLink.png|thumbnail! 
- Create a Service Desk project in Jira, and configure there a knowledge base using the space coming from "Confluence 2"
 !KnowledgeBaseSetting.png|thumbnail! 
- Go to the customer portal, select a request type, and start creating a new request
- From the request creation page, type "laptop" in the summary field. The KB search should suggest the KB page from "Confluence 2"
- Click on the KB article from the search result

h3. Actual Results

The KB page is not open, and the following error is thrown:
{code}
The knowledge base article could not be found.
{code}

Note that if the "Confluence" instance is not reachable from Jira or not running, the following error will be thrown instead:
{code}
We can't link to Confluence because of a problem with the metadata. You can try refreshing the page, but it probably won't fix this one
{code}

h3. Expected results

The KB page should open, as it's the case when we open it from the Customer Portal page (instead of the request creation page).


h3. Workaround

Set the application link corresponding to the Confluence instance where the KB is coming from as "Primary".
(!) In the event where both Confluence instances are providing KB functionality to Jira, the error occurs on the non-primary Confluence pages
fields.summary: Knowledge base articles can't be opened in some cases if Jira is connected to at least 2 Confluence instances

fields.description:
The internal service desks used in the organization to handle the IT support requests often need multiple parties to be mentioned (watchers) so that they can track the closure of the request.

If the user is sending email request, that request gets handled by the email handler in the Service Desk but the email handler in service desk does not automatically add the CC'ed users on the email as watchers. In case of the Custom email handler, this feature is supported but we can not set the request type as "Emailed Request" after the ticket is created in service desk (cloud does not support changing the request type).

As an alternative, the user can share the request with multiple people from the portal, however the emailed request then need to be again updated by the users through portal to make the changes (share the request).

I am suggesting to have the option in Service desk email handler to have options provided by the custom email handler and enhance the emailed requests in Service Desk on Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: Watchers for Service Desk emailed requests

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Affected Jira Service Desk 4.5.1. The use of words in the translation could be improved to have a better notion. There is the use of the personal form of address "deinen". Then in the next sentence, the polite form of address is used "Sie".
 !Mail mit du_Sie Übersetzung.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Either:
* Change the first sentence to use the polite form: "Das zurücksetzen des Passwortes ist für Ihren Benutzernamen deaktiviert."
* Change the second sentence to use the personal form: "Bitte wende dich an deinen Jira Service Desk Administrator,..."

h3. Workaround
Make the changes manually:
(!) Ensure to test in a Staging instance first
# Download or make a copy of the Jira Service Desk obr file (e.g.: jira-servicedesk-application-4.5.1.obr)
(i) If you have the jar file, skip to Step 3
# Extract the file. Access into the extracted folder
# In the folder, extract the jar file
# Access the extracted folder
# Edit the "translation-single-i18n_de_DE.properties" file
# Search for the following entries and make the necessary changes:
{code}
sd.email.conversational.notification.cannot.reset.password.content.disabled
sd.email.conversational.notification.cannot.reset.password.content.contact
{code}
# Save the file
# Compress back all the files back to the original state
# Place the modified and compressed jar file into *<JIRA_HOME>/plugins/installed-plugins* directory of the Jira instance.
** Ensure to replace it with the previous jar file
# Restart Jira instance
fields.summary: Improve the German translation for Password Reset Email

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing an SLA report and drilling down to the current period (most recent day, week or month), the report shows both:
- issues for which the SLA has stopped during that period (expected (/))
- issues for which the SLA is still ticking (not expected (x))

When drilling down to past periods, the report only issues for which the SLA has stopped during that period (expected (/)).

The expected behavior is that for any period (past or current) that we drill down to, the report *should only filter issues for which the SLA has stopped during that period*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new SLA in *Project Settings > SLAs* (or use any existing SLA)
# Create 2 issues
# Make the SLA start on issue 1 by triggering the SLA start condition
# Make the SLA start on issue 2 by triggering the SLA start condition, and then make SLA stop on this same issue by triggering the SLA stop condition
# At this point, the SLA should be running on issue 1, and stopped on issue 2
# Create a new SLA report (for example the Average SLA report) and include a series corresponding to the SLA used for the test
# Drill down in the report to the most current day

h3. Expected Results

The most current day should only show issue 2 where the SLA stopped, since the SLA is still running for issue 1.

h3. Actual Results

Both Issue 1 and Issue 2 are showing in the report.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Drilling down to the most current period in SLA reports shows all issues where the SLA is currently ticking

 java.lang.Throwable
	at java.util.regex.Pattern$CharProperty.match(Pattern.java:3779)

fields.description:
h3. Summary 

In our official documentation [Reporting on SLAs|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver/reporting-on-slas-939926403.html] there doesn't seem to be any mention of how exactly the Average SLA report calculate the elapsed time. An average user would think that the elapsed time shown in the report, will be the same as the SLA shown in the ticket itself.

h3. Suggestions

Add a section to the documentation to explain how does the SLA in the report is being calculated:
{panel}
* The reports looks for all the tickets falling into the requested time interval
* The report groups these tickets in buckets by day
* For each day, we add all the SLA values in milliseconds and divide that value by the number of issues, thus obtaining the average elapsed time.  Note that the average elapsed time takes into account the working hours from the SLA calendar
{panel}
fields.summary: Improve the SLA reports documentation to explain how Average SLA report works in the Service Desk

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
SLAs count are unreadable when the instance is set in Slovak language and exceed one day
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In a JSD project with SLAs set switch the Jira language to Slovak
 # Observe that all the issues with an SLA count which exceed 1 day are wrongly displayed. Specific it seems that since the translation in Slovak for the "Count of weeks" or "Count of days" which are translated into "Počet tý..." or "Počet d..." are too long and the result is that the sentence which should contains the Count of days + the actual number only show the Count of days (Počet d...).

We tested that this was not happening in JSD 4.1.0 but instead is reproducible in version 4.2.4 and 4.4.2 where the structure of JSD jar language packs seems to be changed.

We in fact observed that before the "Count of weeks" or "Count of days" were not translated at all.

Looking at the slovek language pack we see the following line related to the SLAs count:

{code:java}
sd.sla.duration.days.short=Po\u010det dn\u00ed: {0}
{code}

The string is too long to be displayed in the SLA field, therefore it gets cut off.

The suspicion is that this is also happening to many other languages pack.

h3. Expected Results

The expected result is that the SLA numbers are correctly displayed together with the reference (days or weeks) like in English as per this screenshot:

 !Screen Shot 2019-12-19 at 9.51.04 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Instead the sentence is cut off only reporting the "Count of weeks" or "Count of days" without the numbers which are the real useful information here:

 !Screen Shot 2019-12-19 at 9.50.49 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

h3. Workaround

(!) Workaround tested on Service Desk 4.5.1

# Navigate to the link below to download the compatible OBR file for the current your JIRA version
-- [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213632/jira-service-desk/version-history]
# After downloaded, change the {{.obr}} filetype to {{.zip}} so it can be extracted.
# Inside it, there will be another JAR file called {{jira-servicedesk-application-4.5.1.jar}}. (!) *Note that the name might change slightly depending on the Service Desk version that you are using*
# Change the filetype from JAR to ZIP as well to make it extractable.
# Unzip the file into a new temporary folder
# Open the file {{translation-single-i18n_sk_SK.properties}} from the extracted folder
# Locate the 2 following rows:
{code}
sd.sla.duration.days.short=Po\u010det dn\u00ed: {0}
sd.sla.duration.weeks.short=Po\u010det t\u00fd\u017ed\u0148ov: {0}
{code}
# Replace these 2 rows with the following. (!) Note that in this case, we chose the safest solution which is to simply use the English translation "d" (for days), and "w" (for weeks) as we know it fits in the SLA display. But feel free to chance it to a different translation that suits you:
{code}
sd.sla.duration.days.short={0}d
sd.sla.duration.weeks.short={0}w
{code}
# Save the file
# Using the terminal, navigate to the directory where all the files were extracted from the original jar file
# From inside the directory, run the following command:
{code:java}jar cf jira-servicedesk-application-4.5.1.jar *{code}
# The new Jar file jira-servicedesk-application-4.5.1.jar will be created (in the extracted folder) including the fixed translation
# Go to the page *⚙ > Manage Apps > Manage Apps*, and upload the new jar file using the Upload App button
# (!) After the new Jar file is updated, the changes will only take effect after the browser cache is cleared. Another way to check if the translation is working is to either open the browser in Incognito mode, or by using a different browser. The number of days and weeks will be shown as "d" and "w"
 !AfterApplyingTheFix.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: SLAs count are unreadable when the instance is set in Slovak language and exceed 1 day

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In some condition. the SLA is showing in incorrect state in tickets after its configuration has been updated

For example, it is showing as running while it should be paused, based on the pause condition.

Note that this issue does not occur with any type of SLA configuration change, but only with configurations that involve:
 - "Assignee: From Unassigned" as the Start Condition
 - at least 2 "entered status" conditions as the Pause Condition

h3. Steps to reproduce
 - Create a an SLA in a Service Desk project called "Test SLA", using the following settings:
 -- with "Issue Created" as the start condition
 -- with "Status: Waiting for customer", "Status: Waiting for support" as the pause condition
 -- any configuration for the stop condition
 !Step1.png|thumbnail!
 - Create a new ticket, assign it to any user and note that the "Test SLA" is paused. This is expected, since the SLA started when the issue got created, and got paused right after because it entered the status "Waiting for support"
 !Step2.png|thumbnail!
 - Modify the configuration of the "Test SLA" by replacing the start condition from "Issue Created" to "Assignee: From Unassigned":
 !Step3.png|thumbnail!
 - Go back to the issue, and note that now "Test SLA" is now running (after the SLA recalculation completed):
 !Step4.png|thumbnail!
 - Run the SLA reconstruction API call from [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-or-corrupted-sla-data-in-jira-service-desk-828790603.html] to force the SLA to be recalculated against the whole issue history, and notice that the SLA is still shown as running (the API call did not help):
 - Make any change to the ticket (for example, change the priority), and note that "Test SLA" is now paused. (!) Note that the SLA shows as 1h55min and not at 2h, meaning that the pause event was purely caused by the Priority change event and not by the "Status: Waiting for support" event:
 !Step5.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected results

After the start condition of the SLA was updated, the SLA should have been recalculated for the ticket and show the correct SLA status, which should be "Paused", since the condition "Status: Waiting for customer" is one of the SLA pause conditions.
h3. Actual results

The SLA shows as "Running", and can only be paused if any update is made to this issue, for example if the priority field is changed.
 In addition to this, the timing of the SLA gets incorrect after it's paused, as it's using the timing when the priority field was changed, rather than the timing of the actual condition that should have paused the issue ("Status: Waiting for customer").
h3. Workaround

No workaround known so far.

Even the SLA reconstruction API call from [this KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/missing-or-corrupted-sla-data-in-jira-service-desk-828790603.html]  won't fix the SLA.
fields.summary: Under some conditions, the SLA is showing in incorrect state in tickets after its configuration has been updated

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
In the previous Jira Service Desk version there was the possibility to hide/disable the Confluence Knowledge-base section from ServiceDesk issue view if the customer was not using the feature by following the steps into [How to hide/remove the Knowledge-base section from ServiceDesk project navigation sidebar|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-hide-remove-the-knowledge-base-section-from-servicedesk-project-navigation-sidebar-808488650.html] and disabling the *knowledgebase-issueview-panel* module into the *Service Desk Knowledge Base Plugin* in Manage Apps. 

Now the module is instead called *knowledgebase-issueview-panel-old* and by disabling it the Knowledge-base section into the issue view in Service Desk projects is still available.

*Suggested Solution*
Please provide a way to disable the feature as in the past
fields.summary: provide the possibility to disable the Knowledge-base section from ServiceDesk issue view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, in Jira Service Desk if a customer creates a request by email adding Agents and Customers' email addresses in the Cc, Jira will create a request with both, the Customers and the Agents as request participants.

In a specific use case, we don't want the Agents to be added as Request Participants, but the Customers only.

For example, the mail:
To: support@company.com
CC: customer2@company.com, customer3@company.com, agent1@company.com, agent2@company.com

When the ticket is created, will be like this:
Reporter: customer1@example.com
Request Participants: customer2@company.com, customer3@company.com, agent1@company.com, agent2@company.com

But we would like it to be:
Reporter: customer1@example.com
Request Participants: customer2@company.com, customer3@company.com

We would like to have an option to configure it, so agent1 and agent2 are not added.
fields.summary: Add an option to only add Customers from Cc as request participants

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to globally enable and disable Jira Service Desk Public Signup via *Administration >> Applications >> Jira Service Desk : Configuration*. When an administrator wishes to disable public signup globally, Jira will provide a list of Jira Service Desk projects which have signup enabled which will be affected by the change.

The list of projects currently show up as *undefined*, making it impossible for administrators to actually determine what projects will have their public signups disabled as a result.

(i) It is currently unclear when this behavior was introduced, and further testing and review will be needed to determine all affected versions. Known versions begin on 4.4.0 and above.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up a brand new Jira instance running JSD 4.4.0+.
# Create at least one JSD project, and in the *Customer Permissions*, select "Anyone can email the service desk or raise a request in the portal" for the *Who can raise requests?* setting.
# Navigate to *Administration >> Applications >> Jira Service Desk : Configuration*, and disable Public Signup.

h3. Expected Results

The Service Desk projects with Public Signup enabled will be shown to the administrator.

h3. Actual Results

The administrator is shown a list of *undefined* projects:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

No errors are thrown in the application logs. 

h3. Workaround

The list of Service Desks with Public Signup enabled can be queried from the database using a query like the following:
{code}select p.id, p.pkey, p.pname, sd."PUBLIC_SIGNUP"
from "AO_54307E_SERVICEDESK" sd
join project p
on sd."PROJECT_ID" = p.id
where sd."PUBLIC_SIGNUP" = 1;{code}
(i) This query is written for Postgres. Adjust the query as needed for your database.
fields.summary: Disabling Jira Service Desk Public Signup lists projects as undefined
